definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To habituate , accustom , or inure (someone or something) to a particular use, purpose, or circumstance.
examples: to season oneself to a climate

definitions.definition: ( transitive , by extension ) To prepare by drying or hardening , or removal of natural juices .
examples: The timber needs to be seasoned .

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To become mature ; to grow fit for use; to become adapted to a climate.
( intransitive ) To become dry and hard , by the escape of the natural juices, or by being penetrated with other substance.
examples: The wood has seasoned in the sun.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To mingle : to moderate, temper, or qualify by admixture .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To habituate , accustom , or inure (someone or something) to a particular use, purpose, or circumstance.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , by extension ) To prepare by drying or hardening , or removal of natural juices .
( intransitive ) To become mature ; to grow fit for use; to become adapted to a climate.
( intransitive ) To become dry and hard , by the escape of the natural juices, or by being penetrated with other substance.
( transitive ) To mingle : to moderate, temper, or qualify by admixture .

definitions.definition: To flavour food with spices , herbs or salt .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To flavour food with spices , herbs or salt .
